verses.verse: Cast<WH7971> thy bread<WH3899> upon<WH6440> the waters<WH4325>: for thou shalt find<WH4672> it after many<WH7230> days<WH3117>.
Give<WH5414> a portion<WH2506> to seven<WH7651>, and also to eight<WH8083>; for thou knowest<WH3045> not what evil<WH7451> shall be upon the earth<WH776>.

If the clouds<WH5645> be full<WH4390> of rain<WH1653>, they empty<WH7324> themselves upon the earth<WH776>: and if the tree<WH6086> fall<WH5307> toward the south<WH1864>, or toward the north<WH6828>, in the place<WH4725> where the tree<WH6086> falleth<WH5307>, there it shall be<WH1933>.
He that observeth<WH8104> the wind<WH7307> shall not sow<WH2232>; and he that regardeth<WH7200> the clouds<WH5645> shall not reap<WH7114>.

As thou knowest<WH3045> not what is the way<WH1870> of the spirit<WH7307>, nor how the bones<WH6106> do grow in the womb<WH990> of her that is with child<WH4392>: even so thou knowest<WH3045> not the works<WH4639> of God<WH430> who maketh<WH6213> all.

In the morning<WH1242> sow<WH2232> thy seed<WH2233>, and in the evening<WH6153> withhold<WH3240> not thine hand<WH3027>: for thou knowest<WH3045> not whether<WH335> shall prosper<WH3787>, either this or that, or whether they both<WH8147> shall be alike<WH259> good<WH2896>.
¶ Truly the light<WH216> is sweet<WH4966>, and a pleasant<WH2896> thing it is for the eyes<WH5869> to behold<WH7200> the sun<WH8121>:

But if a man<WH120> live<WH2421> many<WH7235> years<WH8141>, and rejoice<WH8055> in them all; yet let him remember<WH2142> the days<WH3117> of darkness<WH2822>; for they shall be many<WH7235>. All that cometh<WH935> is vanity<WH1892>.

¶ Rejoice<WH8055>, O young man<WH970>, in thy youth<WH3208>; and let thy heart<WH3820> cheer<WH2895> thee in the days<WH3117> of thy youth<WH979>, and walk<WH1980> in the ways<WH1870> of thine heart<WH3820>, and in the sight<WH4758> of thine eyes<WH5869>: but know<WH3045> thou, that for all these things God<WH430> will bring<WH935> thee into judgment<WH4941>.
Therefore remove<WH5493> sorrow<WH3708> from thy heart<WH3820>, and put away<WH5674> evil<WH7451> from thy flesh<WH1320>: for childhood<WH3208> and youth<WH7839> are vanity<WH1892>.
